meanings.definition: To make an out in baseball by swinging and missing three times.
meanings.sent1: The batter will strikeout if he misses the ball three times.
meanings.sent2: He always seems to strikeout when the pressure is on.
meanings.sent3: The baseball player decided to strikeout on purpose to give his team a chance to win.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes of winning the game were struckout after missing the final pitch.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bat missing the ball echoed through the stadium as he struckout.

meanings.definition: To remove or cross out written or printed text with a straight line.
meanings.sent1: Please strikeout the incorrect information on the document.
meanings.sent2: She used a pen to strikeout the spelling mistake.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally strikeout the important paragraph while editing the report.
meanings.sent4: The teacher asked us to strikeout any words that were not needed in our essays.
meanings.sent5: The editor's job is to strikeout any errors in the manuscript before it goes to print.

meanings.definition: A failure to achieve a goal or objective.
meanings.sent1: The team's loss was a strikeout for their championship dreams.
meanings.sent2: Experiencing a strikeout can be disappointing but also a learning opportunity.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to climb the mountain ended in a strikeout due to bad weather.
meanings.sent4: The strikeout in reaching the sales target led to a reevaluation of the marketing strategy.
meanings.sent5: The strikeout in the final round of the competition left her feeling defeated.
